Groups.Group: Internet Security Benchmarks + Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Level 1

Advanced.DetectScript:
#!/bin/bash RV=0 REASON="Contents of /etc/hosts.deny is not ALL:ALL." EXPECT="Contents of /etc/hosts.deny is ALL:ALL."
all=$(grep "^ALL: *ALL" /etc/hosts.deny) if [ -z "${all}" ]; then RV=1 fi if [ $RV -eq 1 ]; then echo $REASON >&1 echo $EXPECT >&2 fi exit $RV

Vulnerability.Title: Create /etc/hosts.deny
Vulnerability.Description:
The /etc/hosts.deny file specifies which IP addresses are not permitted to connect to the host. It is intended to be used in conjunction with the /etc/hosts.allow file.
Note: This content will only provide detection of the security threat or vulnerability. Remediation must be performed manually.
